post_title: Do not trust strangers...
FURIA analyst: "Yes, FalleN definitely stays for one more season with FURIA"
Rumors: eraa‚Å† to join Alliance
Would you change anything with the Pickem‚Äôs format?
post_body:
Not a big deal, and admittedly I‚Äôm a bit salty that my Opening Stage pickems were only 4 but I got 5 in Elimination Stage and now really wish I didn‚Äôt pick Fnatic as a 3-1/3-2. At the end of the day Pickems are for fun more than anything but it‚Äôs really annoying how much precision the new format demands. 

You could put a team that you think will 3-0 but they have 1 bad game and because it‚Äôs Bo1s for the first few games, so not only is 1 of your 3-0s picks gone, but now you have 2 incorrect picks in this case. 1 of your 3-0s and 3-1/3-2 picks are incorrect now. 

If I had to change it, I‚Äôd get rid of 1 of the 3-0 slots and put an ‚ÄúAdvancement slot‚Äù where you pick a team that will make it through to the next stage regardless of their losses, similar to the old Pickems where you pick 7 that will advance but this time it‚Äôs just 1. And keep Playoffs the same. Would this work and help fix the minor issue that is the new pickems? Idunno I‚Äôm a redditor. I made this post in under 5 minutes 

10 slots is still a lot to get a decent chance of making it through and I‚Äôm still having fun. Most people can still get 5 correct picks assuming you‚Äôre not Pimp, but what are your thoughts?

post_title: I'm sick of the dialogue surrounding "eras"
post_body:
Sorry in advance for this tangent, but I was watching back the end of the Na'Vi vs. Heroic series and the analyst desk immediately pissed me off. 

The first thing Maui has to say after Heroic's win is: "Unfortunately, there will be no Na'Vi era. The string of grand final finishes, the previous major victory; **all for naught**."

All for naught? Really, Maui? 

I don't even say this as a huge Na'Vi fan, but this team has had a phenomenal year after Copenhagen, winning the Esports World Cup, ESL Pro League, and IEM Masters RIO with respectable grand final finishes in a few other events. But of course, the blemish of not making playoffs at Shanghai means it was all for naught, right? 

I'm sick of this dialogue. In terms of consecutive major wins, there hasn't been an "era" in CS since 2019. It's silly, and frankly sometimes a frustrating expectation that these analysts have of top teams, especially when Tier 1 CS has never been so competitive. 

Who the hell even wants an era anyways? In my opinion, CS was at its least interesting when Astralis was dumpstering every team and winning virtually every big event for years, and as someone who has been watching pro CS since 2014, I felt similarly about the NIP, Fnatic, and LG/SK eras as they were happening. Pro CS is so exciting **right now** because there is no definitive "best team" in the world. 

Now, should Na'Vi have met expectations of at least making playoffs this major? Yes, absolutely.

Has Heroic had a hell of a run to make playoffs, scrapping together the "rejects" of old Heroic and going way further into the major cycle than their counterpart in Astralis? Also, yes.

Don't get me wrong, I'm not saying that we can't hold top teams like Na'Vi to high standards, nor am I even saying that analysts aren't allowed to discuss their failure to meet expectations - but why does Na'Vi's failure have to be the first thing these analysts talk about, when Heroic's accomplishment is way more interesting and exciting, and overall a far more positive dialogue to bring to the viewers?

TL;DR: Maui rubbed me the wrong way and I'm crying Na'Vi glazer tears about him saying that their accomplishments in 2024 were all for naught before even acknowledging Heroic's performance.

Is there still a way to do camera flybys using console commands in a demo without HLAE?
post_body:
So, I remember in CSGO, there used to be a command that let you do really simple camera flybys in a demo, using console commands and it would just figure out the path itself. Could give you some really cool and unique flybys. I tried finding a video, but I couldnt find anything.

I'm trying to make a basic concept reel for a larger project in the future and I dont want to fiddle with HLAE just yet, unless it is the only way. I have used it before, only to export models and animations, not do camera work. 

Anyway, hope someone can help. Thanks :)

post_title: Skullz's super fast 1v4 from FaZe's POV. All kills were within the 5 second defuse time from Karrigan.
That skullz clutch is unironically is among the greatest clutches in all of CS history
post_body:
I've been rewatching that clutch like half a dozen times and holy fucking shit man. Your brain simply can't comprehend what it is witnessing. Like when you watch a donk 1v5 its like yeah, its more skillful but its kind of whatever, you know? It's more skillful then skullz's clutch but there's going to be a tons more 1v5s in the years to come, if you missed this one then you'll probably witness another eventually.

Everyone's seen a few 1v5s live, they're rare...but this?? Bomb being half way defused and skullz just instantly pops everyone and styles on karrigan when the blue defuse bar literally isn't showing any pixels anymore??? Sure, broky and ropz whiffed a little but skullz sure as hell didn't. But even then, no matter how many skullz killed, it just didn't seem possible until he actually did it, like a switch flipped and he broke the CS rules and clawed back a lost round, a lost game. [Just watch the fucking clutch again mate.](https://www.twitch.tv/pgl/clip/FurryCogentEggplantKippa-4WPA6cIywQjI0VQ5)

What makes this clutch truly legendary is that it isn't just a skillful 1v5, no, its fucking MAGIC. 10/10. Clutch enjoyers, we've peaked.

Desk segment constant negativity (Please GTFO)

I have to rant about this. It's no wonder our community is so toxic, when we have these three stooges constantly calling top tier professional players "Bad" and "Embarassing".

The three of you couldn't beat a stack of 18k ELO players in a premier match, yet you somehow feel you have the right to call players who have given so much to the game "bad". Please get this type of commentarty out of the circuit, its not helpful to the professional players and makes young players aspire to be as egotistical and short sighted as you three.

post_title: CS2 Logo Light Box
post_body:
I have been so excited for the CS2 major, waching almost every match, I decided to create an CS2 LED light box.

The crowd noise..
post_body:
It is in no way hating on the crowd, cause they have been amazing in so many aspects.

But I truly don‚Äôt remember a major with so many moments in ever matchup that had this much crowd noise impact.

I‚Äôve been watching a longggg time and remember many moments and events where crowd noise had an impact, including having to remove x ray, etc. for some reason though it seems like ever map I watch has multiple moments you can see a tense moment or timing and the crowd reacts, and the players clearly react afterwards. Over and over.

Future tournaments have to do whatever they can to minimize this in my opinion. No matter what country it is in or team is the home team, it is something I really think needs to be addressed!

post_title: Left or right hand for mouse
post_body:
So I've been playing Counter-Strike since 2019 and in the last few months I thought about which hand I should use the mouse with.

I'm left handed but since I've first touched a computer (as far as I remember) I've used the mouse with my right hand.

Now, it's not like I'm going pro or something, but there's this thought in my mind tormenting me that maybe I should use my left hand for mouse because using my right hand for mouse might limit my aiming abilities.

  
To test my right and left hand, I did the 100 kills 90¬∞ challenge in Aimbotz and here are the results:

[left hand](https://preview.redd.it/rodv6dhxzi5e1.png?width=2560&format=png&auto=webp&s=137707713cb7efbf43b293e5c2ba064a30e29fab)



  


[right hand](https://preview.redd.it/n364z9qyzi5e1.png?width=2560&format=png&auto=webp&s=29e730ec89349fcbf7e1704e0b1a5a5db487dcd6)

So, do you think the difference is big enough and normal so that you can say that I'm much better with my right hand and switching wouldn't be beneficial?

  
Of course one needs to keep in mind that if I do switch to left hand mouse I would need to completely rethink how to use the keyboard to navigate (movement).

I tried to surf with left hand mouse and oh boy I only managed the first ramps on surf\_utopia. While it was smoother than expected I failed when you had to turn to the left or right. With right hand mouse I was just as smooth or even smoother, could finish the map (ramp bugs prevented that though in my offline testing) and was even able to inspect my knife at the same time and experiment by jumping from one side of the ramp to the other just for fun.

Also key binds like P for noclip (insane keybind for noclip but it works for me) would be very uncomfortable if using the right hand for keyboard.



Maybe I'm just overthinking, but this had me thinking on and off for months already...

post_title: CS2 Network Jitter: It‚Äôs Likely Your Connection, Not the Game
post_body:
Like many CS2 players, I initially believed the network jitter issues I was experiencing were due to poor optimization of the game. The new netcode in CS2 seemed to be the culprit, especially since no other games on my system displayed such issues. However, after thorough testing and troubleshooting, I discovered that the problem wasn't with CS2‚Äîit was within my network setup. 

**Key Insights:**

1. **Jitter Can Be Hidden in Other Games:** Even if you experience stable connections in other games or during standard internet usage, CS2's more sensitive netcode can expose underlying issues in your network. This is a critical point to consider before blaming the game itself.
2. **Browser Ping and Jitter Tests Aren't Enough:** Traditional tools or browser-based latency tests often fail to capture the sporadic spikes causing the in-game issues. These tools usually measure stability over longer intervals and won't highlight brief network instabilities.
3. **Use Tools Like PingPlotter:** To diagnose the problem effectively, I ran PingPlotter while playing CS2. This allowed me to visualize latency spikes and jitter as they occurred during gameplay. Without this targeted approach, I wouldn‚Äôt have identified the true cause of the problem.

**A Common Misconception:**  
Many players assume that CS2‚Äôs jitter is purely due to server or game optimization issues. While this can sometimes be true, it‚Äôs essential to rule out your own network as the source. In most cases, network jitter is caused by local factors like unstable Wi-Fi, powerline adapters, or interference on the network. Additionally, in CS2, it appears that when network jitter exceeds a certain threshold, it is converted into packet loss, significantly affecting gameplay.

**My Recommendation:**  
If you're facing persistent network jitter in CS2, test your connection under similar conditions to gameplay. Use tools like PingPlotter to identify hidden spikes or inconsistencies in your connection. Focus on diagnosing your network infrastructure‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs powerline, Wi-Fi, or even routing issues.

These insights completely changed how I approached the issue and allowed me to significantly reduce jitter in CS2. Since I use powerline adapters, I took a closer look at my home network setup. By addressing and minimizing electrical interference within the circuit, I was able to eliminate the ping spikes. Hopefully, this explanation helps others identify and resolve similar network-related problems.
